content.en: AR Surgical Navigation: Researchers have been investigating the use of algorithms in various augmented reality (AR) systems to improve surgical navigation and image-guided surgery. These algorithms, such as the Marker-added ICP algorithm and the Iterative Closest Point (ICP)-based algorithm, are used for accurate registration and alignment of images to the patient. Other algorithms, like the Kanade-Lucas-Tomasi (KLT) feature tracking algorithm and the Simultaneous Localization And Mapping (SLAM) algorithm, are used for camera localization and tracking. These advancements in AR technology have the potential to enhance surgical procedures and improve patient outcomes.
content.da: AR kirurgisk navigation: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer i forskellige augmented reality (AR) systemer for at forbedre kirurgisk navigation og billedstyret kirurgi. Disse algoritmer, såsom Marker-added ICP algoritmen og den Iterative Closest Point (ICP) baserede algoritme, bruges til præcis registrering og justering af billeder til patienten. Andre algoritmer, som Kanade-Lucas-Tomasi (KLT) funktion tracking algoritmen og Simultaneous Localization And Mapping (SLAM) algoritmen, bruges til kameralokalisering og tracking. Disse fremskridt inden for AR teknologi har potentialet til at forbedre kirurgiske procedurer og forbedre patientresultater.
